Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: பகைஎன்னும் பண்பி லதனை ஒருவன் நகையேயும் வேண்டற்பாற்று அன்று.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The evil of hatred is not of a nature to be desired by one even in sport.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is shown playfully juggling several objects for amusement.
Layered_Composition.Midground: One of the objects they are juggling is not a harmless ball, but a dangerous, venomous, coiled serpent, which represents Hatred ('பகை'). The serpent is depicted as having no good qualities ('பண்பிலதனை').
Layered_Composition.Background: The image captures the immense folly and danger of this act. Treating something so inherently evil as a plaything ('நகையேயும்') is shown to be an act of extreme foolishness, with the serpent ready to strike at any moment.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: One must not desire the characterless evil of hatred, not even as a joke or for sport.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The venomous serpent as hatred is the key metaphor. The act of juggling it as a plaything represents treating it lightly or 'in sport'.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A bright, playful light on the person and the other juggling balls, which contrasts sharply with the dark, menacing, and venomous appearance of the serpent.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A close-up on the juggler, focusing on their oblivious expression and the dangerous serpent in their hands.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: High-contrast lighting to emphasize the danger of the serpent.

Cultural_Anchors: Hatred, the characterless evil ('பகை என்னும் பண்பிலதனை')
Not to be desired even in jest ('நகையேயும் வேண்டற்பாற்று அன்று')
The inherent danger of toying with enmity.

Flux_Optimized_Prompt.Negative_Prompt: a friendly serpent, a scared juggler, text artifacts, cartoonish.
